UIProjects.title: Draggable Cards
UIProjects.description: Imagine playing a {{bold|card game}} where you {{bold|drag cards around}} and {{bold|match them}} based on their class. We can create this using Unity's UI Toolkit. In this project, we did learn how to drag cards inside a container and detect when they match using {{bold|special events}}. This is a {{bold|basic tool}} that can be used to develop various card games like {{bold|Match}} and {{bold|Memory}}.

ARProjects.title: AR Furniture - Retail Industry
ARProjects.description: Retail is not only a {{bold|multi-trillion dollar industry}}, but one constantly looking for {{bold|innovations}}. {{bold|Augmented reality}} has offered this industry novel ways to {{bold|showcase their products and services}}, and also given developers new opportunities for different kinds of applications. Using {{bold|Unity}} and {{bold|AR Foundation}}, this explore {{bold|AR mechanics}} that allow users to manipulate {{bold|spawned furnitures}}, including {{bold|moving objects}}, {{bold|rotating}} them, and {{bold|modifying their appearance}}. This app that implements all these features.

ShaderProjects.title: Stencil Buffer: Playing with other dimensions
ShaderProjects.description: Stencil shaders are like {{bold|magic tools}} that help decide where things get drawn on your screen. By marking areas with the stencil buffer and using these marks to decide where to draw, you can create {{bold|amazing effects}} like {{bold|portals}} and {{bold|windows}}. Portals are a {{bold|popular effect}} in games and simulations, providing the illusion of looking or stepping through one area into another seamlessly. Similar to portals, {{bold|windows}} can be created using stencil shaders to offer a {{bold|view into another part of the scene}} or an entirely different scene
